list.title: aggregate
list.description:
Takes a FeatureCollection or a set of Features or Geometries and merge them based on their topology.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/aggregate?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: bbox
list.description:
Compute a geographic bounding box for a given FeatureCollection / array of Features / array of Geometries. The bounding box is returned wrapped in a FeatureCollection containing a single Polygon Feature.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/bbox?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: border
list.description:
Extract boundaries from a GeoJSON FeatureCollection / an array of Features / an array of Geometries (of polygons). Options enable to get ids and calculate discontinuities.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/border?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: buffer
list.description:
Build a buffer with GEOS-WASM around a FeatureCollection or a set of Features or Geometries.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/buffer?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: buffer2
list.description:
Build a buffer with GEOS-WASM around a FeatureCollection or a set of Features or Geometries.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/buffer?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: centroid
list.description:
Calculate the centroid of all the geometries given in a GeoJSON FeatureCollection / array of Features / array of Geometries.

By default, the centroid is placed in the largest polygon of each geometry. This can be changed by setting the options.largest parameter to false.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/centroid?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: densify
list.description:
Densify a geoJSON with GEOS-WASM

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/densify?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: dissolve
list.description:
Dissolve multipart geometries to single part geometries.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/dissolve?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: featurecollection
list.description:
Wrap a GeoJSON object in a FeatureCollection. It accepts:

  • a single Feature
  • a single Geometry
  • an array of Features
  • an array of Geometries

If the GeoJSON object is already a FeatureCollection, it is returned as-is.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/featurecollection?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: filter
list.description:
Create and return a new GeoJSON FeatureCollection containing all the elements of the original GeoJSON FeatureCollection that meet a condition determined by the callback function applied on properties (or geometries).

The function returns a new GeoJSON FeatureCollection and does not modify the initial GeoJSON Object.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/filter-geojson?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: geolines
list.description:
Returns a GeoJSON FeatureCollection of natural geographic lines such as the equator, tropics & polar circles.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/geolines?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: makevalid
list.description: Returns a geoJSON which is valid according to the GEOS validity rules, and preserves as much as possible of the input geometry's extent, dimension, and structure.

list.title: map
list.description:
Create a new GeoJSON FeatureCollection with the results of a function call provided on each element of GeoJSON properties (or geometries).

The function returns a new GeoJSON FeatureCollection and does not modify the initial GeoJSON Object.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/map-geojson?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: module:Properties.add
list.description:
Add a new field in the attribute table of the GeoJSON FeatureCollection. This function returns a new object and does not modify the initial object.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/handle-properties?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: module:Properties.head
list.description:
Get the first n Features of a GeoJSON FeatureCollection. This function returns a new object and does not modify the initial object.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/handle-properties?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: module:Properties.keep
list.description:
Keep only the specified fields in the attribute table of the GeoJSON FeatureCollection. This function returns a new object and does not modify the initial object.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/handle-properties?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: module:Properties.remove
list.description:
Remove one or several columns in the attribute table. This function returns a new object and does not modify the initial object.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/handle-properties?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: module:Properties.select
list.description:
Filter a GeoJSON FeatureCollection by its attribute table. This function returns a new object and does not modify the initial object.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/handle-properties?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: module:Properties.subset
list.description:
Create a subset from an array of values. This function returns a new object and does not modify the initial object.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/handle-properties?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: module:Properties.table
list.description:
Return the attribute table of the GeoJSON FeatureCollection (i.e. the properties of each Feature). This function returns a deep copy of the original properties.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/handle-properties?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: module:Properties.tail
list.description:
Get the last n Features of a GeoJSON FeatureCollection. This function returns a new object and does not modify the initial object.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/handle-properties?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: simplify
list.description:
Simplify geometries of a GeoJSON FeatureCollection / Array of Features / Array of Geometries using topojson-simplify library.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/simplify?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: tissot
list.description:
Generate Tissot's indicatrix.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/tissot?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}

list.title: type
list.description: Return the geometry type contained in a GeoJSON FeatureCollection

list.title: union
list.description:
Takes a FeatureCollection or a set of Features or Geometries containing Polygons and merge them with GEOS-WASM.

Example: {@link https://observablehq.com/@neocartocnrs/union?collection=@neocartocnrs/geotoolbox Observable notebook}
